history.narrative: Law 11-248, the “Boating While Intoxicated Act of 1996,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 11-567, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted in first and second readings on November 7, 1996, and December 3, 1996, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 24, 1996, it was assigned Act No. 11-511 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 11-248 became effective on April 9, 1997.
